description: The Professional Education scheme by the Jammu and Kashmir Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (JKBOCWWB) provides financial assistance to the children of registered construction workers for pursuing professional courses. The scheme aims to support higher education and career development.
key_features: Covers children of registered construction workers

benefits.assistance_amount: Varies based on course and board guidelines
benefits.coverage: Tuition fees, books, and other expenses

education_criteria: Students enrolled in professional courses (e.g., engineering, medical, law)
Courses must be recognized by UGC, AICTE, or equivalent
additional_criteria: Parent must be a registered construction worker with JKBOCWWB
Must be a resident of Jammu and Kashmir
eligibility.admission_requirement: Admission to recognized institutions through merit or entrance tests

eligible_courses_delhi: Engineering, medical, law, management, and other professional courses
Courses approved by UGC, AICTE, or equivalent

steps: Obtain application form from JKBOCWWB office

required_documents.note: To prove Jammu and Kashmir residency

special_notes: Assistance amount varies based on course type
Renewal requires proof of academic progress
